AddressBase.description: Address represents the address as retrieved from the database

name.description:
**required for purchase**
First and Last Name of the addressee

street1.description:
**required for purchase**
First street line, 35 character limit. Usually street number and street name (except for DHL Germany, see street_no).

street3.description:
Third street line, 35 character limit. 
Only accepted for USPS international shipments, UPS domestic and UPS international shipments.

street_no.description:
Street number of the addressed building. 
This field can be included in street1 for all carriers except for DHL Germany.

city.description:
**required for purchase**
Name of a city. When creating a Quote Address, sending a city is optional but will yield more accurate Rates. Please bear in mind that city names may be ambiguous (there are 34 Springfields in the US). Pass in a state or a ZIP code (see below), if known, it will yield more accurate results.

state.description:
**required for purchase for some countries**
State/Province values are required for shipments from/to the US, AU, and CA. UPS requires province for some countries (i.e Ireland). To receive more accurate quotes, passing this field is recommended. Most carriers only accept two or three character state abbreviations.

zip.description:
**required for purchase**
Postal code of an Address. When creating a Quote Addresses, sending a ZIP is optional but will yield more accurate Rates.

country.description: Example: `US` or `DE`. All accepted values can be found on the Official ISO Website. Sending a country is always required.

phone.description:
Addresses containing a phone number allow carriers to call the recipient when delivering the Parcel. This 
increases the probability of delivery and helps to avoid accessorial charges after a Parcel has been shipped.

email.description: E-mail address of the contact person, RFC3696/5321-compliant.

metadata.description:
A string of up to 100 characters that can be filled with any additional information you want 
to attach to the object.

is_complete.description:
Complete addresses contain all required values.

Incomplete addresses have failed one or multiple validations.
Incomplete Addresses are eligible for requesting rates but lack at least one required value for purchasing labels.

object_created.description: Date and time of Address creation.

object_id.description:
Unique identifier of the given Address object. 
This ID is required to create a Shipment object.

object_owner.description: Username of the user who created the Address object.

object_updated.description:
Date and time of last Address update. Since you cannot update Addresses after they were created, this time 
stamp reflects the time when the Address was changed by Shippo's systems for the last time, e.g., during the 
approximation of one or more values.

test.description: Indicates whether the object has been created in test mode.

AddressTo.description: Address object of the recipient / buyer. Will be returned expanded by default.

AddressFrom.description: Address object of the sender / seller. Will be returned expanded by default.

AddressReturn.description:
ID of the Address object where the shipment will be sent back to if it is not delivered (Only available for UPS, USPS, and Fedex shipments).
If this field is not set, your shipments will be returned to the address_from.

validate.description: Set to true to validate Address object.

AddressFromCreateRequest.description: Address object of the sender / seller. Will be returned expanded by default..

AddressToCreateRequest.description: Address object of the recipient / buyer. Will be returned expanded by default.

AddressPickupCompleteCreateRequest.description:
The pickup address, which includes your name, company name, street address, city, state, zip code, 
country, phone number, and email address (strings). Special characters should not be included in 
any address element, especially name, company, and email.

AddressImporter.description: Object that represents the address of the importer

name.description: First and Last Name of the addressee

street1.description: First street line, 35 character limit. Usually street number and street name (except for DHL Germany, see street_no).

street3.description:
Third street line, 35 character limit. 
Only accepted for USPS international shipments, UPS domestic and UPS international shipments.

street_no.description:
Street number of the addressed building. 
This field can be included in street1 for all carriers except for DHL Germany.

state.description:
**required for purchase for some countries**
State/Province values are required for shipments from/to the US, AU, and CA. UPS requires province for some countries (i.e Ireland). To receive more accurate quotes, passing this field is recommended. Most carriers only accept two or three character state abbreviations.

country.description: Example: `US` or `DE`. All accepted values can be found on the Official ISO Website. Sending a country is always required.

phone.description:
Addresses containing a phone number allow carriers to call the recipient when delivering the Parcel. This 
increases the probability of delivery and helps to avoid accessorial charges after a Parcel has been shipped.

email.description: E-mail address of the contact person, RFC3696/5321-compliant.

is_residential.description: Indicates whether the address provided is a residential address or not.

object_id.description: ID of importer address object

AddressValidationResults.description: Object that contains information regarding if an address had been validated or not. Also contains any messages generated during validation. Children keys are is_valid(boolean) and messages(array).

text.example: City, State and ZIP Code are valid, but street address is not a match.

Alcohol.description: Indicates that a shipment contains Alcohol (Fedex and UPS only).

contains_alcohol.description: Mandatory for Fedex and UPS. Specifies that the package contains Alcohol.

recipient_type.description: Mandatory for Fedex only. License type of the recipient of the Alcohol Package.

AmountAndCurrencyCharged.description: The amount and currency that was charged after possible currency conversion occurred.

currency.description: The currency that 'amount' is in. The official ISO 4217 currency codes are used, e.g. "USD" or "EUR". ISO 4217 Standard.
The currency that 'amount' is in. The official ISO 4217 currency codes are used, e.g. "USD" or "EUR". ISO 4217 Standard.

ConversionAmount.description: Invoice Item's amount after currency conversion took place.

rate.description: Currency conversion rate, relative to USD, that was used to calculate the converted amount.

time.description: Date and time the currency conversion took place.

amount.description: The money amount after currency conversion.

currency.description: The currency that 'amount' is in. The official ISO 4217 currency codes are used, e.g. "USD" or "EUR". ISO 4217 Standard.

default_carrier_account.description:
ID of the Carrier Account object to use as the default for all shipments in this Batch. 
The carrier account can be changed on a per-shipment basis by changing the carrier_account in the 
corresponding BatchShipment object.

default_servicelevel_token.description: Token of the service level to use as the default for all shipments in this Batch. The servicelevel can be changed on a per-shipment basis by changing the servicelevel_token in the corresponding BatchShipment object. Servicelevel tokens can be found here.

metadata.description: A string of up to 100 characters that can be filled with any additional information you want to attach to the object.

label_url.description: An array of URLs each pointing to a merged file of 100 labels each

object_created.description: Date and time of Batch creation

object_id.description: Unique identifier of the given Batch object

object_owner.description: Username of the user who created the Address object.

object_updated.description: Date and time of last update to the Batch

status.description:
Batches that are `VALIDATING` are being created and validated
`VALID` batches can be purchased
`INVALID` batches cannot be purchased, `INVALID` BatchShipments must be removed
Batches that are in the `PURCHASING` state are being purchased
`PURCHASED` batches are finished purchasing.

batch_shipments.description: Array of BatchShipment objects. The response keeps the same order as in the request array.

carrier_account.description: Object ID of the carrier account to be used for this shipment (will override batch default)

metadata.description:
A string of up to 100 characters that can be filled with any additional information you want 
to attach to the object.

servicelevel_token.description: A token that sets the shipping method for the batch, overriding the batch default. Servicelevel tokens can be found in this list or at this endpoint.

messages.description: List of Shipment and Transaction error messages.

object_id.description: Object ID of this batch shipment. Can be used in the remove_shipments endpoint.

status.description:
`INVALID` batch shipments cannot be purchased and will have to be removed, fixed, and added to the batch again.
`VALID` batch shipments can be purchased.
Batch shipments with the status `TRANSACTION_FAILED` were not able to be purchased and the error will be displayed on the message field
`INCOMPLETE` batch shipments have an issue with the Address and will need to be removed, fixed, and added to the batch again.

transaction.description: Object ID of the transaction object created for this batch shipment.

allOf.description: Array of BatchShipment objects. The response keeps the same order as in the request array.

Billing.description: Specify billing details (UPS, FedEx, and DHL Germany only).

account.description: Account number to be billed. (For DHL Germany, leave this field blank.)

country.description: Country iso2 code of account number to be billed (required for UPS third party billing only).

participation_code.description: 2 digit code used to override your default participation code associated with your DHL Germany account.

type.description: Party to be billed. (Leave blank for DHL Germany.)

zip.description: ZIP code of account number to be billed (required for UPS if there is a zip on the billing account).

COD.description: Specify collection on delivery details (UPS only).

currency.description: Currency for the amount to be collected. Currently only USD is supported for UPS.

payment_method.description: Secured funds include money orders, certified cheques and others (see UPS for details). If no payment_method inputted the value defaults to "ANY".)

COD.title: COD Specify collection on delivery details (UPS only).

carrier.description: The name of the carrier that provides this parcel template

height.description: The height of the package, in units specified by the distance_unit attribute

is_variable_dimensions.description: True if the carrier parcel template allows custom dimensions, such as USPS Softpack.

length.description: The length of the package, in units specified by the distance_unit attribute

name.description: The name of the carrier parcel template

token.description: The unique string representation of the carrier parcel template

width.description: The width of the package, in units specified by the distance_unit attribute

CarrierParcelTemplate.title: CarrierParcelTemplate represents the fields of a template before saving it to the db.

CustomerReference.description: Specify the reference field on the label (FedEx only).

prefix.description:
Custom prefix for customer reference field (ZPL labels only). Up to 11 characters, including trailing 
spaces. Empty string indicates removal of default prefix. To use the default prefix, do not include
this property.

value.description:
Optional text to be printed on the shipping label for customer reference. Up to 40 characters. If 
this is provided, reference_1 will be ignored.

aes_itn.description:
**required if eel_pfc is `AES_ITN`**
AES / ITN reference of the shipment.

b13a_number.description:
**must be provided if and only if b13a_filing_option is provided**
Represents:
the Proof of Report (POR) Number when b13a_filing_option is `FILED_ELECTRONICALLY`;
the Summary ID Number when b13a_filing_option is `SUMMARY_REPORTING`;
or the Exemption Number when b13a_filing_option is `NOT_REQUIRED`.

certify.description: Expresses that the certify_signer has provided all information of this customs declaration truthfully.

certify_signer.description:
Name of the person who created the customs declaration and is responsible for the validity of all 
information provided.

contents_explanation.description:
**required if contents_type is `OTHER`**
Explanation of the type of goods of the shipment.

disclaimer.description: Disclaimer for the shipment and customs information that have been provided.

exporter_reference.description: Exporter reference of an export shipment.

importer_reference.description: Importer reference of an import shipment.

is_vat_collected.description: Indicates whether the shipment's destination VAT has been collected. May be required for some destinations.

metadata.description:
A string of up to 100 characters that can be filled with any additional information you 
want to attach to the object.

notes.description: Additional notes to be included in the customs declaration.

CustomsDeclarationB13AFilingOptionEnum.description: B13A Option details are obtained by filing a B13A Canada Export Declaration via the Canadian Export Reporting System (CERS). More information on reporting commercial exports from Canada.

CustomsDeclarationContentsTypeEnum.description: Type of goods of the shipment.

CustomsDeclarationEelPfcEnum.description:
EEL / PFC type of the shipment. For most shipments from the US to CA, `NOEEI_30_36` is applicable; for most 
other shipments from the US, `NOEEI_30_37_a` is applicable.

CustomsDeclarationIncotermEnum.description:
The incoterm reference of the shipment. FCA is available for DHL Express and FedEx only. 
eDAP is available for DPD UK only. DAP is available for DHL Express and DPD UK.
If expecting DAP for other carriers, please use DDU.

CustomsDeclarationNonDeliveryOptionEnum.description: Indicates how the carrier should proceed in case the shipment can't be delivered.

address_importer.description: Object ID of the Importer address.

items.description: Distinct Parcel content items as Customs Items object_ids.

object_created.description: Date and time of object creation.

object_id.description: Unique identifier of the given object.

object_owner.description: Username of the user who created the object.

object_updated.description: Date and time of last object update.

test.description: Indicates whether the object has been created in test mode.

CustomsExporterIdentification.description: Additional exporter identification that may be required to ship in certain countries

eori_number.description: Economic Operators' Registration and Identification (EORI) number. Must start with a 2 character country code followed by a 6-17 character alphanumeric identifier (e.g. PL1234567890ABCDE). More information on EORI.

CustomsInvoicedCharges.description: Additional invoiced charges to be shown on the Customs Declaration Commercial Invoice.

currency.description: Currency for the invoiced charges amounts incurred on the end consumer.

total_shipping.description: Total shipping paid by the buyer.

total_taxes.description: Total taxes paid by the buyer.

total_duties.description: Total duties paid by the buyer.

other_fees.description: Other fees paid by the buyer.

eccn_ear99.description: Export Control Classification Number, required on some exports from the United States.

metadata.description:
A string of up to 100 characters that can be filled with any additional information you 
want to attach to the object.

net_weight.description: Total weight of this item, i.e. quantity * weight per item.

origin_country.description: Country of origin of the item. Example: `US` or `DE`. All accepted values can be found on the Official ISO Website.

quantity.description: Quantity of this item in the shipment you send.  Must be greater than 0.

sku_code.description: SKU code of the item, which is required by some carriers.

tariff_number.description: The tariff number of the item.

value_amount.description: Total value of this item, i.e. quantity * value per item.

value_currency.description: Currency used for value_amount. The official ISO 4217 currency codes are used, e.g. `USD` or `EUR`.

object_created.description: Date and time of object creation.

object_id.description: Unique identifier of the given object.

object_owner.description: Username of the user who created the object.

object_updated.description: Date and time of last object update.

test.description: Indicates whether the object has been created in test mode.

CustomsTaxIdentification.description:
Tax identification that may be required to ship in certain countries. Typically used to assess duties on 
goods that are crossing a border.

type.description:
Type of tax identification.
* `EIN` - Employer Identification Number, also known as a Federal Tax Identification Number.
* `VAT` - Value Added Tax identification number.
* `IOSS` - Import One-Stop Shop
* `ARN` - Australian Taxation Office Reference Number

DangerousGoodsBiologicalMaterial.description: Container for specifying the presence of biological material.

contains.description: Indicates if the shipment contains biological material.

DangerousGoodsLithiumBatteries.description: Container for specifying the presence of lithium batteries.

contains.description: Indicates if the shipment contains lithium batteries.

DangerousGoodsObject.description: Container for specifying the presence of dangerous materials. This is specific to USPS, and if any contents are provided, only certain USPS service levels will be eligible. For more information, see our guide on hazardous or dangerous materials shipping.

contains.description: Indicates if the shipment contains dangerous goods.

DepartmentNumber.description: Specify the department number field on the label (FedEx only).

prefix.description:
Custom prefix for department number field (ZPL labels only). Up to 11 characters, including trailing 
spaces. Empty string indicates removal of default prefix. To use the default prefix, do not include
this property.

value.description: Optional text to be printed on the shipping label for department number. Up to 40 characters.

DryIce.description: Specify that the package contains Dry Ice (FedEx, Veho, and UPS only).

contains_dry_ice.description: Mandatory. Specifies that the package contains Dry Ice.

weight.description: Mandatory. Units must be in Kilograms. Cannot be greater than package weight.

ShipmentExtra.description: An object holding optional extra services to be requested.

ancillary_endorsement.description: Specify an ancillary service endorsement to provide the USPS with instructions on how to handle undeliverable-as-addressed pieces (DHL eCommerce only).

authority_to_leave.description:
Request `true` to give carrier permission to leave the parcel in a safe place if no one answers the 
door (where supported). When set to `false`, if no one is available to receive the item, the parcel 
will not be left (*surcharges may be applicable).

bypass_address_validation.description: Bypasses address validation (USPS, UPS, & LaserShip only).

carbon_neutral.description: Request carbon offsets by passing true (UPS only).

carrier_hub_travel_time.description: Travel time in hours from fulfillment center to carrier injection site.

critical_pull_time.description:
Carrier arrival time to pickup packages from the fulfillment center. 
UTC format: `%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ`

dangerous_goods_code.description: Dangerous Goods Code (DHL eCommerce only). See Category Codes

delivery_instructions.description: Specify delivery instructions. Up to 500 characters. (FedEx and OnTrac only).

fulfillment_center.description: The fulfilment center where the package originates from.

is_return.description: This field specifies if it is a scan-based return shipment. See the Create a return shipment section for more details.

lasership_attrs.description: Specify Lasership Attributes (Lasership only). Multiple options accepted.

preferred_delivery_timeframe.description: Required for DHL Germany Paket Sameday. Designates a desired timeframe for delivery. Format is `HHMMHHMM`

premium.description: Add premium service to a shipment (DHL Germany international shipments only).

qr_code_requested.description: Request a QR code for a given transaction when creating a shipping label (USPS domestic and Evri UK only).

reference_1.description: Optional text to be printed on the shipping label if supported by carrier. Up to 50 characters.

reference_2.description: Optional text to be printed on the shipping label if supported by carrier. Up to 50 characters. For DHL eCommerce, this field can be used for billing reference.

request_retail_rates.description: Returns retail rates instead of account-based rates (UPS and FedEx only).

return_service_type.description: Request additional return option for return shipments (UPS only).

saturday_delivery.description: Marks shipment as to be delivered on a Saturday.

signature_confirmation.description:
Request standard or adult signature confirmation. You can alternatively request Certified Mail (USPS only) 
or Indirect signature (FedEx only) or Carrier Confirmation (Deutsche Post only).

ConnectExistingOwnAccountParameters.title: Account parameters
ConnectExistingOwnAccountParameters.description: An array of additional parameters for the account, such as e.g. password or token. Please check our carrier accounts guide for the parameters per carrier. To protect account information, this field will be masked in any API response.

Insurance.description:
To add 3rd party insurance powered by XCover, specify
`amount`, `content`, and `currency`.
Alternatively, you can choose carrier provided insurance by additionally specifying `provider` (UPS, FedEx and OnTrac only).

If you do not want to add insurance to you shipment, do not set these parameters.

amount.description: Declared value of the goods you want to insure.

currency.description:
Currency for the amount value.
Currently only USD is supported for FedEx and UPS.

provider.description: To have insurance cover provided by a carrier directly instead of Shippo's provider (XCover), set `provider` to `FEDEX`, `UPS`, or `ONTRAC`.

InvoiceNumber.description: Specify the invoice number field on the label (FedEx only).

prefix.description:
Custom prefix for invoice number field (ZPL labels only). Up to 11 characters, including trailing 
spaces. Empty string indicates removal of default prefix. To use the default prefix, do not include
this property.

value.description:
Optional text to be printed on the shipping label for invoice number. Up to 40 characters. If 
provided, this will be used on the label instead of shipment.customs_declaration.invoice.

manufacture_country.description: Country the item was manufactured in. In the Shippo dashboard, this value will be used ot pre-fill the customs declaration when creating a label for this order.

max_delivery_time.description:
The date and time this item needs to be delivered by, i.e. by when the carrier delivers it to the buyer. 
This value is used by some platforms such as eBay to measure a seller's shipping time and performance. 
It will be displayed in the Shippo dashboard.

max_ship_time.description:
The date and time this item needs to be fulfilled by, i.e. by when the shipping label needs to be 
created and handed over to the carrier. This value is used by some platforms such as eBay to measure 
a seller's handling time and performance. It will be displayed in the Shippo dashboard.

quantity.description: The quantity of this item in this order.

sku.description: The stock keeping unit value of this item.

total_price.description: Total price paid by the buyer for this item (or these items, if quantity > 1).

variant_title.description:
A variant is a specific variation of an item (e.g. `size M` or `color blue`). 
Variants might be exposed as a separate resource in the future too. 
Currently the variant title is a free text field describing the variant.

weight.description: Total weight of this/these item(s). Instead of specifying the weight of all items, you can also set the total_weight value of the order object.

object_id.description: Unique identifier of the line item object.

oneOf.description: Object ID for an existing Address

address_from.description:
The sender address, which includes your name, company name, street address, city, state, zip code, 
country, phone number, and email address (strings). Special characters should not be included in 
any address element, especially name, company, and email.

oneOf.description: Object ID for an existing Address

address_to.description:
The recipient address, which includes the recipient's name, company name, street address, city, state, zip code, 
country, phone number, and email address (strings). Special characters should not be included in 
any address element, especially name, company, and email.

oneOf.description: Object ID for an existing User Parcel Template

parcel.description: Object ID for an existing User Parcel Template OR a fully formed Parcel object.

amount.description: The value of the price for the service group, in units of currency of the sender address

amount_local.description: The value of the price for the service group, in the currency of the destination address

currency.description: The ISO 4217 currency code for the price

currency_local.description: The ISO 4217 currency code for the currency describing amount_local

estimated_days.description: The estimated days in transit of the rate that powers the shipping option, if available.

title.description: The name of the service group being returned

Location.description: Location where the parcel(s) will be picked up.

building_location_type.description:
Where your parcels will be available for pickup. "Security Deck" and "Shipping Dock" are only 
supported for DHL Express.

building_type.description: The type of building where the pickup is located.

instructions.description: Pickup instructions for the courier. This is a mandatory field if the building_location_type is "Other".

shipment_date.description:
All shipments to be submitted on this day will be closed out. 
Must be in the format `2014-01-18T00:35:03.463Z` (ISO 8601 date).

transactions.description:
IDs transactions to use. If you set this to null or not send this parameter, 
Shippo will automatically assign all applicable transactions.

address_from.description:
ID of the Address object that should be used as pickup address for the scan form. 
The USPS will validate this address before creating the scan form.

documents.description: An array containing the URLs to all returned manifest documents.

errors.description: An array of codes and messages describing the error that occurred if any.

object_created.description: Date and time of object creation.

object_id.description: Unique identifier of the given object.

object_owner.description: Username of the user who created the object.

object_updated.description: Date and time of last object update.

status.description: Indicates the status of the manifest.

generic_carrier_error.description: There is an error from the carrier that requires investigation. Please contact support with the object ID of this response.

carrier_account_invalid_credentials.description: The carrier account contains invalid credentials. Please update your carrier account with valid credentials.

carrier_account_access_denied.description: There is an issue with your carrier account. Please contact support with the information of your account manager at the carrier and the object ID of this response.

manifest_invalid_transactions.description: For this carrier, all shipments must be manifested on the same day that they are created regardless of shipment date.

manifest_no_transactions.description: There are no shipments in the manifest. Please check that the shipment date of the shipments matches the shipment date of the manifest.

address_from_missing_zip.description: The sender address is missing the zip. Please update the sender address and try again.

address_from_invalid_zip1.description: The sender address contains an invalid zip. Please update the sender address and try again.

address_from_invalid_zip2.description: The sender address contains an invalid zip. Please update the sender address and try again. You can also try removing the last 4 digits of the zip.

address_from_missing_city.description: The sender address is missing the city. Please update the sender address and try again.

address_from_invalid_city.description: The sender address contains an invalid city. Please update the sender address and try again.

address_from_missing_state.description: The sender address is missing the state. Please update the sender address and try again.

address_from_invalid_state.description: The sender address contains an invalid state. Please update the sender address and try again.

address_from_missing_name.description: The sender address is missing the name. Please update the sender address and try again.

shipment_date_missing.description: The shipment date is missing. Please update the shipment date and try again.

shipment_date_invalid.description: The shipment date is invalid. Please update the shipment date and try again.

oneOf.description:
ID of the Address object that should be used as pickup address for the scan form. 
The USPS will validate this address before creating the scan form.

currency.description:
**Required if total_price is provided**
Currency of the total_price and total_tax amounts.

notes.description: Custom buyer- or seller-provided notes about the order.

order_number.description: An alphanumeric identifier for the order used by the seller/buyer. This identifier doesn't need to be unique.

placed_at.description: Date and time when the order was placed. This datetime can be different from the datetime of the order object creation on Shippo.

shipping_cost.description: Amount paid by the buyer for shipping. This amount can be different from the price the seller will actually pay for shipping.

shipping_cost_currency.description:
**Required if shipping_cost is provided**
Currency of the shipping_cost amount.

shipping_method.description:
Shipping method (carrier + service or other free text description) chosen by the buyer. 
This value can be different from the shipping method the seller will actually choose.

total_price.description: Total amount paid by the buyer for this order.

total_tax.description: Total tax amount paid by the buyer for this order.

OrderStatusEnum.description: Current state of the order. See the orders tutorial for the logic of how the status is handled.

line_items.description: Array of line item objects representing the items in this order. All objects will be returned expanded by default.

object_id.description: Unique identifier of the order object.

object_owner.description: Username of the user who created the object.

shop_app.description:
Platform the order was created on and, if applicable, imported from. 
Orders created via the Shippo API or dashboard will have the value "Shippo".

transactions.description: Array of transaction objects representing all shipping labels purchased for this order. All objects are returned expanded with a limited number of fields by default.

line_items.description: Array of line item objects representing the items in this order. All objects will be returned expanded by default.

distance_unit.description: The measure unit used for length, width and height. Required if template is not specified.

height.description:
**Required if template is not specified**
Height of the parcel. Up to six digits in front and four digits after the decimal separator are accepted.

length.description:
**Required if template is not specified**
Length of the Parcel. Up to six digits in front and four digits after the decimal separator are accepted.

metadata.description: A string of up to 100 characters that can be filled with any additional information you want to attach to the object.

object_created.description: Date and time of Parcel creation.

object_id.description: Unique identifier of the given Parcel object. This ID is required to create a Shipment object.

object_owner.description: Username of the user who created the Parcel object.

object_state.description: A Parcel will only be valid when all required values have been sent and validated successfully.

object_updated.description: Date and time of last Parcel update. Since you cannot update Parcels after they were created, this time stamp reflects the time when the Parcel was changed by Shippo's systems for the last time, e.g., during sorting the dimensions given.

test.description: Indicates whether the object has been created in test mode.

weight.description: Weight of the parcel. Up to six digits in front and four digits after the decimal separator are accepted.

width.description:
**Required if template is not specified**
Width of the Parcel. Up to six digits in front and four digits after the decimal separator are accepted.

distance_unit.description: The measure unit used for length, width and height. Required if template is not specified.

height.description:
**Required if template is not specified**
Height of the parcel. Up to six digits in front and four digits after the decimal separator are accepted.

length.description:
**Required if template is not specified**
Length of the Parcel. Up to six digits in front and four digits after the decimal separator are accepted.

weight.description: Weight of the parcel. Up to six digits in front and four digits after the decimal separator are accepted.

width.description:
**Required if template is not specified**
Width of the Parcel. Up to six digits in front and four digits after the decimal separator are accepted.

ParcelExtra.description: An object holding optional extra services to be requested for each parcel in a multi-piece shipment. See the Parcel Extra table below for all available services.

reference_1.description: Optional text to be printed on the shipping label if supported by carrier. Up to 50 characters.

reference_2.description: Optional text to be printed on the shipping label if supported by carrier. Up to 50 characters.

ParcelInsurance.description:
To add insurace to your parcel, specify `amount`, `content` and `currency`.

If you do not want to add insurance to you parcel, do not set these parameters.

amount.description: Declared value of the goods you want to insure.

currency.description: Currency for the amount value. Currently only USD is supported for FedEx and UPS.

provider.description: To have insurance cover provided by a carrier directly instead of Shippo's provider (XCover), set provider to `FEDEX`, `UPS`, or `ONTRAC`.

distance_unit.description: The measure unit used for length, width and height. Required if template is not specified.

height.description: Required if template is not specified. Height of the parcel. Up to six digits in front and four digits after the decimal separator are accepted.

length.description: Required if template is not specified. Length of the Parcel. Up to six digits in front and four digits after the decimal separator are accepted.

metadata.description: A string of up to 100 characters that can be filled with any additional information you want to attach to the object.

test.description: Indicates whether the object has been created in test mode.

weight.description: Weight of the parcel. Up to six digits in front and four digits after the decimal separator are accepted.

width.description: Required if template is not specified. Width of the Parcel. Up to six digits in front and four digits after the decimal separator are accepted.

carrier_account.description: The object ID of your USPS or DHL Express carrier account. You can retrieve this from your Rate requests or our Carrier Accounts endpoint.

metadata.description:
A string of up to 100 characters that can be filled with any additional information you 
want to attach to the object.

requested_end_time.description:
The latest that you requested your parcels to be available for pickup. 
Expressed in the timezone specified in the response.

requested_start_time.description:
The earliest that you requested your parcels to be ready for pickup. 
Expressed in the timezone specified in the response.

transactions.description: The transaction(s) object ID(s) for the parcel(s) that need to be picked up.

object_created.description: Date and time of Pickup creation.

object_id.description: Unique identifier of the given Pickup object.

object_updated.description: Date and time of last Pickup update.

confirmed_start_time.description:
The earliest that your parcels will be ready for pickup, confirmed by the carrier. 
Expressed in the timezone specified in the response.

confirmed_end_time.description:
The latest that your parcels will be available for pickup, confirmed by the carrier. 
Expressed in the timezone specified in the response.

cancel_by_time.description:
The latest time to cancel a pickup. Expressed in the timezone specified in the response. 
To cancel a pickup, you will need to contact the carrier directly. 
The ability to cancel a pickup through Shippo may be released in future iterations.

status.description: Indicates the status of the pickup.

confirmation_code.description:
Pickup's confirmation code returned by the carrier. 
To edit or cancel a pickup, you will need to contact USPS or DHL Express directly and provide your `confirmation_code`.

timezone.description: The pickup time windows will be in the time zone specified here, not UTC.

messages.description: An array containing strings of any messages generated during validation.

is_test.description: Indicates whether the object has been created in test mode.

detail.example: Your registration unfortunately failed due to the following UPS error: Missing or invalid ControlID.

PoNumber.description: Specify the PO number field on the label (FedEx only).

prefix.description:
Custom prefix for PO number field (ZPL labels only). Up to 11 characters, including trailing 
spaces. Empty string indicates removal of default prefix. To use the default prefix, do not include
this property.

value.description:
Optional text to be printed on the shipping label for PO number. Up to 40 characters. If 
this is provided, reference_2 will be ignored.

amount.description: Final Rate price, expressed in the currency used in the sender's country.

amount_local.description: Final Rate price, expressed in the currency used in the recipient's country.

arrives_by.description: Predicted time the carrier will deliver the package in the destination's local time zone. In the format `HH:MM:SS`.

attributes.description:
An array containing specific attributes of this Rate in context of the entire shipment. 
Attributes can be assigned `CHEAPEST`, `FASTEST`, or `BESTVALUE`.

carrier_account.description: Object ID of the carrier account that has been used to retrieve the rate.

currency.description: Currency used in the sender's country, refers to `amount`. The official ISO 4217 currency codes are used, e.g. `USD` or `EUR`.

currency_local.description: Currency used in the recipient's country, refers to `amount_local`. The official ISO 4217 currency codes are used, e.g. `USD` or "EUR".

duration_terms.description:
Further clarification of the transit times. 
Often, this includes notes that the transit time as given in "days" is only an average, not a guaranteed time.

estimated_days.description:
Estimated transit time (duration) in days of the Parcel at the given servicelevel. 
Please note that this is not binding, but only an average value as given by the provider. 
Shippo is not able to guarantee any transit times.

included_insurance_price.description:
Cost to the user to insure the Rate for the requested amount of coverage, if insurance coverage was requested. 
Expressed in the currency used in the sender's country. Will be null if no insurance coverage was requested, or if insurance is requested from a non-standard insurance provider. 
Please note this price is already included in the `amount` and `amount_local` fields on the Rate. Do not add this field to them.

messages.description:
An array containing elements of the following schema:
`source`(string): the name of the carrier sending the message.
`code` (string): carrier specific identifier code for the corresponding message (not always available).
`text` (string): a publishable message containing further information (not always available).

object_created.description: Date and time of Rate creation.

object_id.description: Unique identifier of the given Rate object.

object_owner.description: Username of the user who created the rate object.

provider.description: Carrier offering the rate, e.g., `FedEx` or `Deutsche Post DHL`.

provider_image_75.description:
URL to the provider logo with max. dimensions of 75*75px. 
Please refer to the provider's Logo Usage Guidelines before using the logo.

provider_image_200.description:
URL to the provider logo with max. dimensions of 200*200px. 
Please refer to the provider's Logo Usage Guidelines before using the logo.

test.description: Indicates whether the object has been created in test mode.

zone.description: The parcel's transit zone token. These tokens can vary depending on the provider.

text.example: RatedShipmentWarning: User Id and Shipper Number combination is not qualified to receive negotiated rates.

object_created.description: Date and time of object creation.

object_id.description: Unique identifier of the given object.

object_owner.description: Username of the user who created the object.

object_updated.description: Date and time of last object update.

status.description: Indicates the status of the Refund.

test.description: Indicates whether the object has been created in test mode.

transaction.description: Object ID of the Transaction to be refunded.

RmaNumber.description: Specify the RMA number field on the label (FedEx only).

prefix.description:
Custom prefix for RMA number field (ZPL labels only). Up to 11 characters, including trailing 
spaces. Empty string indicates removal of default prefix. To use the default prefix, do not include
this property.

value.description: Optional text to be printed on the shipping label for RMA number. Up to 40 characters.

flat_rate.description:
String representation of an amount to be returned as the flat rate
if 1. The service group is of type `LIVE_RATE` and no matching rates
were found; or 2. The service group is of type `FLAT_RATE`. Either
integers or decimals are accepted. Required unless type is
`FREE_SHIPPING`

free_shipping_threshold_min.description: For service groups of type `FREE_SHIPPING`, this field must be required to configure the minimum cart total (total cost of items in the cart) for this service group to be returned for rates at checkout. Optional unless type is `FREE_SHIPPING`

name.description: Name for the service group that will be shown to customers in the response

rate_adjustment.description: The amount in percent (%) that the service group's returned rate should be adjusted. For example, if this field is set to 5 and the matched rate price is $5.00, the returned value of the service group will be $5.25. Negative integers are also accepted and will discount the rate price by the defined percentage amount.

ServiceGroupTypeEnum.description:
The type of the service group.
`LIVE_RATE` - Shippo will make a rating request and return real-time rates for the shipping group, only falling back to the specified flat rate amount if no rates match a service level in the service group.
`FLAT_RATE` - Returns a shipping option with the specified flat rate amount.
`FREE_SHIPPING` - Returns a shipping option with a price of $0 only if the total cost of items exceeds the amount defined by `free_shipping_threshold_min`

object_id.description: The unique identifier of the given Service Group object.

is_active.description: True if the service group is enabled, false otherwise.

object_id.description: The unique identifier of the given Service Group object.

is_active.description: True if the service group is enabled, false otherwise.

account_object_id.description: ID of a Carrier Account object

service_level_token.description:
Service level token, e.g. `usps_priority` or `fedex_ground`.
See Service Levels.

ServiceLevel.description: Contains details regarding the service level for the given rate.

name.description:
Name of the Rate's servicelevel, e.g. `International Priority` or `Standard Post`. 
A servicelevel commonly defines the transit time of a Shipment (e.g., Express vs. Standard), along with other properties. 
These names vary depending on the provider.

token.description: Token of the Rate's servicelevel, e.g. `usps_priority` or `fedex_ground`. See servicelevels.

extended_token.description:
Unique, extended version of the Service Level "token". 
Guaranteed to be unique across all Service Levels, and may help offer insight into the specific Service Level it describes.

parent_servicelevel.description:
Used for some Service Levels to link to the more "generic" version of this Service Level - for example, 
if this Service Level is a variation specific to shipments to Europe("ups_saver_eu"), the "parent" is 
the fully generic version ("ups_saver"). Helpful when displaying Service Levels to users. Has the same 
structure of the servicelevel - "name", "token", "terms", and "extended_token", or it is otherwise null.

customs_declaration.description: ID of the Customs Declarations object for an international shipment.

metadata.description: A string of up to 100 characters that can be filled with any additional information you want to attach to the object.

shipment_date.description:
Date the shipment will be tendered to the carrier. Must be in the format `2014-01-18T00:35:03.463Z`. 
Defaults to current date and time if no value is provided. Please note that some carriers require this value to
be in the future, on a working day, or similar.

allOf.description: Shipment represents the parcel as retrieved from the database

carrier_accounts.description:
An array of object_ids of the carrier account objects to be used for getting shipping rates for this shipment. 
If no carrier account object_ids are set in this field, Shippo will attempt to generate rates using all the 
carrier accounts that have the `active` field set.

text.example: RatedShipmentWarning: User Id and Shipper Number combination is not qualified to receive negotiated rates.

messages.description:
An array containing elements of the following schema:
`code` (string): an identifier for the corresponding message (not always available)
`message` (string): a publishable message containing further information.

object_created.description: Date and time of Shipment creation.

object_id.description: Unique identifier of the given Shipment object.

object_owner.description: Username of the user who created the Shipment object.

object_updated.description: Date and time of last Shipment update.

parcels.description: List of Parcel objects to be shipped.

rates.description: An array with all available rates. If async has been set to false in the request, this will be populated with all available rates in the response. Otherwise rates will be created asynchronously and this array will initially be empty.

status.description:
`Waiting` shipments have been successfully submitted but not yet been processed. 
`Queued` shipments are currently being processed. 
`Success` shipments have been processed successfully, meaning that rate generation has concluded. 
`Error` does not occur currently and is reserved for future use.

test.description: Indicates whether the object has been created in test mode.

oneOf.description: Address `object_id` of a previously created address.
Address `object_id` of a previously created address.
Address `object_id` of a previously created address.

carrier_accounts.description: List of Carrier Accounts `object_id`s used to filter the returned rates. If set, only rates from these carriers will be returned.

oneOf.description: Parcel `object_id` of a previously created parcel.

carrier.description: Name of the carrier of the shipment to track. See Carriers.

eta.description: The estimated time of arrival according to the carrier, this might be updated by carriers during the life of the shipment.

metadata.description: A string of up to 100 characters that can be filled with any additional information you want to attach to the object.

original_eta.description: The estimated time of arrival according to the carrier at the time the shipment first entered the system.

tracking_history.description: A list of tracking events, following the same structure as tracking_status. It contains a full history of all tracking statuses, starting with the earlier tracking event first.

transaction.description: The object_id of the transaction associated with this tracking object. This field is visible only to the object owner of the transaction.

TrackingStatus.description: The latest tracking information of this shipment.

status_date.description: Date and time when the carrier scanned this tracking event. This is displayed in UTC.

status_details.example: Your shipment has been delivered at the destination mailbox.
status_details.description: The human-readable description of the status.

TrackingStatusEnum.description: Indicates the high level status of the shipment.

TrackingStatusLocation.description: An object containing zip, city, state and country information of the tracking event.

TrackingStatusFromLocation.description: The sender address with city, state, zip and country information.

TrackingStatusToLocation.description: The recipient address with city, state, zip and country information.

TrackingStatusSubstatus.description: A finer-grained classification of the tracking event.

code.description: A code that represents the substatus of the shipment. See the Event Definitions for more information.

text.description: A human-readable description of the substatus. See the Event Definitions for more information.

action_required.description: Indicates whether the substatus requires action from the shipper or recipient to complete delivery.

carrier.description: Name of the carrier of the shipment to track.

metadata.description: A string of up to 100 characters that can be filled with any additional information you want to attach to the object.

commercial_invoice_url.description:
A URL pointing to the commercial invoice as a 8.5x11 inch PDF file. 
A value will only be returned if the Transactions has been processed successfully and if the shipment is international.

eta.description: The estimated time of arrival according to the carrier.

label_url.description:
A URL pointing directly to the label in the format you've set in your settings. 
A value will only be returned if the Transactions has been processed successfully.

messages.description:
An array containing elements of the following schema:
`code` (string): an identifier for the corresponding message (not always available)
`message` (string): a publishable message containing further information.

metadata.description:
A string of up to 100 characters that can be filled with any additional information you want to 
attach to the object.

object_created.description: Date and time of Transaction creation.

object_id.description: Unique identifier of the given Transaction object.

object_owner.description: Username of the user who created the Transaction object.

object_updated.description: Date and time of last Transaction update.

qr_code_url.description:
A URL pointing directly to the QR code in PNG format. 
A value will only be returned if requested using qr_code_requested flag and the carrier provides such an option.

rate.description:
ID of the Rate object for which a Label has to be obtained. 
Please note that only rates that are not older than 7 days can be purchased in order to ensure up-to-date pricing.

test.description: Indicates whether the object has been created in test mode.

tracking_number.description:
The carrier-specific tracking number that can be used to track the Shipment. 
A value will only be returned if the Rate is for a trackable Shipment and if the Transactions has been processed successfully.

tracking_url_provider.description:
A link to track this item on the carrier-provided tracking website. 
A value will only be returned if tracking is available and the carrier provides such a service.

TransactionStatusEnum.description: Indicates the status of the Transaction.

object_id.description: Unique identifier of the given Invoice object

object_created.description: Date and time of Invoice creation.

object_updated.description: Date and time of last Invoice update.

shippo_account.description: Unique identifier of the user who the Invoice has been issued to.

invoice_number.description: Human readable unique identifier of the given Invoice object that is displayed in the web app.

invoice_closed.description: Date and time of when the Invoice was posted and no new Invoice Items were added. Field will be null when invoice is still in the draft status.

invoice_paid_date.description: Date and time of when the Invoice was successfully paid. Field will be null when invoice is not in the paid status.

object_id.description: Unique identifier of the given Invoice Item object.

object_created.description: Date and time of Invoice Item creation.

object_updated.description: Date and time of last Invoice Item update.

shippo_account.description: Unique identifier of the user who the Invoice Item has been issued to.

description.description: Additional information about what the Invoice Item is for.

amount.description: The money amount that the Invoice Item represents.

currency.description: The currency that 'amount' is in. The official ISO 4217 currency codes are used, e.g. "USD" or "EUR". ISO 4217 Standard.

invoice.description: Unique identifier of the Invoice that the Invoice Item belongs to.

transaction.description: Unique identifier of the Transaction that the Invoice Item represents. Not all Invoice Items are linked to a transaction.

InvoiceItemTypesEnum.description: The type of the Invoice Item. |Type| Description| |:---|:---| | LABEL_PAYMENT | Invoice Item for the payment of a label. | | LABEL_SURCHARGE | Invoice Item for a surcharge of a label. See here for more information. | | LABEL_REFUND | Invoice Item for a refund of a label. | | ONE_OFF_CREDIT | Invoice Item for credit given by Shippo. | | TRACK_FEE | Invoice Item for fees associated with tracking services. | | ADDRESS_VALIDATION_FEE | Invoice Item for fees associated with global address validation services. | | SUBSCRIPTION_PLAN_FEE | Invoice Item for subscription plan fees. | | PROMO_CODE_CREDIT | Invoice Item for promotional code related credits. | | PREAUTH_CAPTURE | Invoice Item for preauthorization capture. Represents a credit. See here for more information. | | LABEL_PAYMENT_ADJUSTMENT | Invoice Item for adjustments on label purchases. | | LABEL_REFUND_ADJUSTMENT | Invoice Item for adjustments on label refunds. |

UPSConnectExistingOwnAccountParameters.title: UPS account parameters
UPSConnectExistingOwnAccountParameters.description:
An array of additional parameters for the account, such as e.g. password or token. Please check the carrier accounts tutorial page for the parameters per carrier.
To protect account information, this field will be masked in any API response.

aia_country_iso2.description: Only required if has_invoice is true. Country associated with the account that issued the invoice

collec_zip.description: Zip code of the collection/pickup address

company.description: Company name. Full name is acceptable in this field if the user has no company name

currency_code.description: Only required if has_invoice is true. 3-letter currency code associated with invoice_value

has_invoice.description: true if user has been issued a UPS invoice within the past 90 days for the US or Canada; and 45 days for any other countries. User can use data from any of the last 3 invoices

invoice_controlid.description: Only required if aia_country_iso2 is US and has_invoice is true.

invoice_date.description: Only required if has_invoice is true. Date the invoice was issued. yyyymmdd format

invoice_value.description: Only required if has_invoice is true. Max 16 digits before decimal and 2 digits after decimal

title.description: User's title, e.g. including but not limited to Manager, Doctor, Artist, Engineer, Mr, Ms, Mrs, Mx

ups_agreements.description: Whether the user agrees to the UPS terms and conditions or not. Error 400 will be returned if passed in as false

account_id.description: This field is required as input to the API, but is not used for UPS. Use the empty string.

company.description: Company name. Full name is acceptable in this field if the user has no company name

pickup_address_city.description: User's pickup address city. Only required if pickup_address_same_as_billing_address is false

pickup_address_country_iso2.description: User's pickup street 1. Only required if pickup_address_same_as_billing_address is false

pickup_address_state.description: User's pickup address state. Only required if pickup_address_same_as_billing_address is false

pickup_address_street1.description: User's pickup address street 1. Only required if pickup_address_same_as_billing_address is false

pickup_address_street2.description: User's pickup street 2. Only used if pickup_address_same_as_billing_address is false, empty string acceptable

pickup_address_zip.description: User's pickup address zip code. Only required if pickup_address_same_as_billing_address is false

ups_agreements.description: Whether the user agrees to the UPS terms and conditions or not. Error 400 will be returned if passed in as false

account_id.description:
Unique identifier of the account. Please check the carrier accounts tutorial page for the `account_id` per carrier.
To protect account information, this field will be masked in any API response.

active.description:
Determines whether the account is active. When creating a shipment, if no `carrier_accounts` are explicitly 
passed Shippo will query all carrier accounts that have this field set. By default, this is set to True.

carrier.description:
Carrier token, see Carriers
Please check the carrier accounts tutorial page for all supported carriers.

object_info.description: Holds internal state relevant to users.

type.description: Authentication method used by this account.

status.description: Current authentication status. Possible values: 'disconnected' (authorization lost, reconnect needed), 'connected' (authorized and active), 'authorization_pending' (awaiting initial authorization flow).

object_id.description: Unique identifier of the carrier account object.

object_owner.description: Username of the user who created the carrier account object.

test.description: Indicates whether the object has been created in test mode.

CarrierAccountServiceLevel.description: Contains details regarding the service level for the carrier account.

name.description:
Service level name, e.g. `Priority Mail` or `FedEx Ground®`. A service level commonly defines the transit time of a Shipment (e.g., Express vs. Standard), along with other properties. These names vary depending on the provider.
See Service Levels.

token.description:
Service level token, e.g. `usps_priority` or `fedex_ground`.
See Service Levels.

supports_return_labels.description: Whether or not the service level supports return labels.

error.example: Only US shippers can create a new USPS account

canada_post_terms.description: Whether or not the user agrees to Canada Post's terms. If passed in as false, request will fail with error 400

phone.description: Needs to be a valid phone number and cannot be null

user_accepted_terms_and_conditions.description: Whether or not the user agrees to the DHL Express Terms and Conditions. If passed in as false, request will fail with error 400

company.description: Company name. Full name is acceptable in this field if the user has no company name

phone.description: Needs to be a valid phone number and cannot be null

ups_agreements.description: Whether the user agrees to the UPS terms and conditions or not. Error 400 will be returned if passed in as false

distance_unit.description: The measure unit used for length, width and height. Required, but if using a preset carrier template then this field must be empty.

height.description: The height of the package, in units specified by the `distance_unit` attribute. Required, but if using a preset carrier template then this field must be empty.

length.description: The length of the package, in units specified by the `distance_unit` attribute. Required, but if using a preset carrier template then this field must be empty.

name.description: The name of the User Parcel Template

weight.description: The weight of the package, in units specified by the weight_unit attribute.

width.description: The width of the package, in units specified by the `distance_unit` attribute. Required, but if using a preset carrier template then this field must be empty.

allOf.title: A request to create or update a new parcel template.

UserParcelTemplateWithCarrierTemplateCre.title: A request to create or update a new parcel template.

template.description: The object representing the carrier parcel template

weight.description: The weight of the package, in units specified by the weight_unit attribute.

object_created.description: Date and time of User Parcel Template creation

object_id.description: Unique identifier of the given User Parcel Template object

object_owner.description: Username of the user who created the User Parcel Template object

object_updated.description: Date and time of last update on User Parcel Template

allOf.title: The fields of a parcel template before saving it to the db.
